title: Business & Finance
text:
Major U.S. stock indexes advanced Monday, but the S&P 500 logged a loss of 5.3% for January, its worst month since March 2020. The Nasdaq and Dow fell 9% and 3.3%, respectively, in January.

---

As the coronavirus emerged, Pershing Square's Ackman made billions of dollars betting that the market was misjudging the virus's economic toll. He did it again a year later.

---

Burned out teachers are leaving the classroom for jobs in the private sector, where talent-hungry companies are hiring them, often for better pay.

---

Sony 's videogame unit said that it is buying Bungie, the creator of "Halo" and "Destiny," in a deal valued at $3.6 billion.

---

Qatar Airways agreed to purchase as many as 50 of Boeing 's new 777X freighter jets, launching the plane during a boom in air cargo.

---

Exxon is moving its corporate headquarters from Irving, Texas, to Houston as part of a business reorganization that the company said will be completed by 2023.

---

Citrix agreed to be taken private in an all-cash acquisition valued at $16.5 billion, including debt.
